tweets.text:
Another day another @EnvAgency failure.

Four out of nine water companies in England are now rated as poor when it comes to pollution, the worst result since 2011.

For how much longer I wonder will @MPGeorgeEustice tolerate the incompetence?

https://t.co/X05iHf0Lxu

High winds and heavy rain could cause surface water and river flooding over the weekend. Do not try to drive through floodwater. Be prepared. For the latest updates see
https://t.co/G0SjP0XBX4, or call Floodline on 0345 988 1188.

Our Fisheries Team cleared large amounts of debris from the fish pass on the River Wear in Durham yesterday. 

The build-up blocked one of the routes fish use to get upstream to their spawning grounds. 

Once cleared lots of fish swim straight on their way!
#Fish #River #trees https://t.co/rn9KMrQQhh

Flood risk across the country this weekend. You can check flood warnings for free here (updated every 15 minutes). https://t.co/CnoJPZIDpY If you don't know what @EnvAgency's flood warnings mean, see ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/u6wZHLZJ9t

Breaking through!
An amazing moment here as the River Trent is set free into first of several natural meanders being created @StaffsUni! Part of #StaffsSUNRISE project, we're transforming this section into a dynamic habitat for wildlife.
Pls share! 
@StaffsUnion @LizbarnesStaffs https://t.co/Cme6P2698z

Water firms in England criticised over rising environmental pollution 

 - @EnvAgency says pollution from nine companies at worst level in five years

Story by @sandralaville 
https://t.co/KgI7WR2K9Z

Sadly #flood #forecast for the weekend has worsened. Low likelihood of significant impacts from surface water & river. @EnvAgencyNW prep work continues. #BePrepared #floodaware #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/YYPj5C5R15

New figures show #water company #pollution incidents rose from 1,863 in 2018 to 2,204 in 2019. 

Anglian, Southern, South West & Northumbrian Water all rated poor by @EnvAgency, putting the #25YearEnvironmentPlan & ecological recovery at risk.

https://t.co/WCsN6fStKk https://t.co/bHhT3FoqXm

More stormy weather is expected this weekend across southern parts of England

Stay safe and sign up for flood alerts:
https://t.co/P5d6Ax7xwQ 
#Floods #Flooding https://t.co/pjTy4RChyo

urls.title: Levels of Somerset river pollution 'absolutely terrifying'
urls.description: Tests of Somerset's rivers found mercury, lead, insecticides and flame-retardant compounds present.

tweets.text: Good to see @BBCNews running my piece on how polluted #Somerset's rivers have become, according to @EnvAgencySW - and what @pow_rebecca is doing about it: https://t.co/BvU4243xcu #LDReporter

tweets.text: Registration checks at #Bourne End Marina yesterday ,working closely with managing estates team for Shanley  to improve their self regulation of section 60 licensable structures.‚Å¶@EnvAgencySE‚Å© ‚Å¶@MarkHill03‚Å© ‚Å¶@wifo_ea‚Å© ‚Å¶@Ang_WaterwaysEA‚Å© ‚Å¶ https://t.co/kBMai6rfvJ

Stark warning from @EnvAgency to several water companies as environmental performance fails to improve

- total number of pollution incidents has increased

https://t.co/zAo8oRRgfm

@JayneMonie1 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice Those fines will only end up on all our water bills and we will all pay. Likewise investment to improve the situation will be costly and paid for by us. So long as public prioritise cheaper bills, and companies prioritise profit, nothing will change.

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice If I was as utterly useless at my job I'd have been got shot of years ago. @MPGeorgeEustice how about you hold our water companies to account? How about THEY get heavily penalised EVERY time they FLY TIP sewage into our rivers due to their utter incompetenceü§¨

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
9pm, Thursday:

No flood alerts CURRENTLY in our region, but Friday will be wet and windy as #StormAlex swings by...

Why not sign-up for flood alerts straight to your device? Plenty of great advice ‚¨áÔ∏è 

Free and easy... 

‚Ä¶https://t.co/64gyL62UXF #floodaware #MartinLewis https://t.co/dNRUwwrvF3

tweets.text: @HeritageFundUK @KathCockshaw @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DCMS Hi there, we still can't get into the online application. Do you have any update on when it will be resolved? Thanks

#Fish of the Severn Estuary are under threat. Thousands of fish will die in the double-decker sized cooling tunnels at Hinkley Point C. @EnvAgency @CefasGovUK @The_MMO please make the right decision and make sure an AFD is installed, as the DCO states. #SaveSevernsFish

What a lovely surprise in the post yesterday. Recognition of the hard that our previous year 6 engaged with as part of the Climate Champion competition earlier this year. Well done and thankyou - a great project! @EnvAgency @STEMCumbria1 @STEMLearningUK https://t.co/gTpyGjyBvi
Time to revoke some licenses @EnvAgency @pow_rebecca @ab4scambs @DanielZeichner @OliverHealdUK @DefraGovUK https://t.co/yt7KfpDs4W

tweets.text: Good to see coverage of Anaerobic Digesters on @BBCNews this morning. A couple of things, support is needed for all sized farms and careful management of the spreading of digestate @EnvAgency to prevent eutrophication. Help to develop off-grid refuelling networks too. https://t.co/bkZzCXF47o
